Title: In South Africa, Foes Are Humanized
Reason: Article is about success in negotiations for the release of political prisoners between African National Congress and the South African government and does not mention anything about apartheid as such

Title: The World; Will Mandela's Triumphs Abroad Enlarge His Power Back Home?
Reason: Article highlights that success of Mandela on his world tour might lead de Klerk with no choice but to negotiate end of apartheid with Mandela

Title: MANDELA HOPEFUL ON BRITISH TALKS
Reason: Article is about Mandela’s meeting with British Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher to continue impose of sanctions on South Africa in order to force South African government of de Klerk to completely abolish apartheid

Title: Johannesburg Journal; For an Afrikaner Weekly, Success Brings Bombs
Reason: Article is about how the bombing at a newspaper office made the newspaper the most discussed and controversial among all newspapers

Title: South Africa Easing Up on Its Political Censorship of Books
Reason: Article is about South Africa lifting censorship on books that it earlier feared could inspire revolutions

Title: South Africa Said to Capture Rebel Infiltrators as New Talks Near
Reason: The article is about some armed guerrillas being captured before talks between African National Congress and South African government

Title: Mandela Is Home, and Happy as 'a Boy of 36'
Reason: The article is about Mandela returning home after his visit to the US

Title: PAPER IS BOMBED IN JOHANNESBURG
Reason: The article is about a bomb explosion at a newspaper office that wrote article on a plot to kill Mandela and de Klerk

Title: Mandela Calls British Talks 'Productive'
Reason: Article is about Mandela’s meeting with Margaret Thatcher to discuss sanctions on South Africa and ending of apartheid which Mandela describes as having achieved some success

Title: BEFORE APARTHEID, AND POSSIBLY AFTER
Reason: The article is about a book written on the history of South Africa

Title: The World; South Africa, Alone Again, Makes Way For Communism
Reason: Article is about how lift of ban on a Communist Party which was an ally of African National Congress could affect South Africa

Title: Violence And Hypocrisy
Reason: The article is about US willing that Mandela and his supporters give up violence to achieve their goal of ending apartheid and other goals in South Africa

Title: Ban Lifted, Communists Gather in South Africa
Reason: Article is about supporters of the banned Communist Party gathering after de Klerk uplifted a ban on it and mentions how Mandela agreed to the right for the party to exist and that communism may support the anti-apartheid movement

Title: Across South Africa, Shattering Days of Violence
Reason: Article is about growing violence across South Africa in the days leading to another round of negotiations between the African National Congress and the South African government to end apartheid

Title: The Essential Mandela
Reason: The article is about the influence of Mandela in the US especially among black Americans who admired him for his struggle against white people back home

Title: SOUTH AFRICA ENDS EMERGENCY DECREE IN 3 OF 4 PROVINCES
Reason: Article is about President de Klerk announcing the ending of emergency regulations in four provinces of South Africa and mentions Mandela praising him for it as it was a first step towards anding racism in South Africa

Title: Terrorist or Freedom Fighter? Pretoria Debates Whom to Amnesty
Reason: Article is a debate among African National Congress and South African government on terms under which a person should be considered a political prisoner or a terrorist for fighting against Apartheid

Title: MANDELA DECLINES TO RULE OUT FORCE
Reason: Article is about Mandela ruling out the use of violence to achieve goals of release of all political prisoners and lifting of emergency regulations throughout South Africa

Title: Congress Was Right
Reason: Article is about the effect of economic sanctions by the US Congress on Mandela’s release by de Klerk and on the struggle against apartheid

Title: The Mandela Visit; MANDELA'S TRIP IS TRIUMPH AT HOME
Reason: Article is about Mandela being hailed as a celebrity back in South Africa after his trip to the United States

Title: Hero Hunger
Reason: The article is about Mandela becoming a hero in the minds of the American people especially the Black Americans

Title: The Mandela Visit; Pretoria Arrests 11 Whites Reportedly Tied to Plot to Kill Mandela
Reason: Article is about the arrest and release of 11 white people who were involved in plotting to kill Mandela and de Klerk for their policies against apartheid

Title: The Mandela Visit; Mandela Backs Sanctions And Meets U.S. Executives
Reason: Article is about Mandela asking in United Nations and other people he met on his tour to not lift economic sanctions on South Africa till their goals of apartheid abolishment and other goals were met

Title: Mandela Urges Canadians to Maintain Sanctions
Reason: Article is about Mandela asking Canada to maintain sanctions on South Africa since apartheid had not been abolished till date and mentions de Klerk as well

Title: The Mandela Visit; Mandela Invokes Struggles Of U.S., Rousing Congress
Reason: Article is which Mandela says that US revolutionaries inspired him for his struggle in South Africa and says he is happy that United States continues to impose sanctions on South Africa

Title: The Mandela Visit; Far Rightists Meet de Klerk in Pretoria and Come Away Dissatisfied
Reason: Article is about de Klerk meeting white extremists and telling them that he wanted to share power with the African National Congress and that he would continue towards apartheid abolishment

Title: The Mandela Visit; Europe Keeps The Sanctions
Reason: The article is about Europe not lifting sanctions on South Africa due to Mandela’s request of no sanction upliftment until apartheid system was completely dismantled and mentions de Klerk as well

Title: Johannesburg Journal; An Exile Comes Home to Soweto's Sad Embrace
Reason: The article is about a member of the African National Congress coming back to South Africa after spending 30 years in exile and finding that the system of apartheid was still intact

Title: MANDELA DEPARTS ON A WORLD TRIP
Reason: Article is about Mandela going on a world trip for six weeks

Title: Preparations Are Hectic for Mandela's U.S. Tour
Reason: Article is about preparations for Mandela’s US tour and mentions his agenda of asking nations not to lift sanctions on South Africa until abolishment of the apartheid system

Title: Squeeze Apartheid, Not Mr. de Klerk
Reason: Article is about Mandela saying that economic sanctions are meant to end apartheid and not against the South African president de Klerk who was already supporting the end of apartheid

Title: De Klerk, Addressing Blacks, Speaks of a New Constitution
Reason: Article is about de Klerk announcing to black people that the South African government would be ready to draft a new constitution abolishing apartheid and that he would lift further restrictions on black people

Title: The War on Apartheid is Far From Over
Reason: Article gives details on the war on Apartheid and has Mandela and de Klerk as main subjects

Title: Mr. Mandela's Moment
Reason: Article is about the eagerness of Americans to catch a glimpse of Mandela on his visit to New York

Title: Mandela the Messenger: Celebrated, Yet Life-Size
Reason: Article has Nelson Mandela as main subject and highlights his struggle against apartheid and has him mentioning that de Klerk was not doing enough for the abolishment of apartheid

Title: Getting Closer in Pretoria
Reason: Article is about President de Klerk announcement of the ending of emergency regulations in four provinces of South Africa and mentions Mandela trying to calm down black militants and trying for peaceful resolution to the apartheid problem

Title: The Mandela Visit; Mandela Gets an Emotional New York City Welcome
Reason: Article is about Mandela’s visit to New York to gather support against apartheid and to ask nations to not lift sanctions on South Africa until apartheid abolishment and the article has mention of de Klerk as well

Title: Why Won't Mandela Renounce Violence?
Reason: Article is debating whether Mandela should stop members and supporters of the African National Congress to shun violence and meet their goals of apartheid abolishment in a non-violent way

Title: As Mandela Stumps for Sanctions, South Africa Debates Them
Reason: Article is about the effect of sanctions on apartheid and has frequent mentions of Mandela and de Klerk

Title: The Mandela Visit; Washington, About to Receive Mandela, Is Worried About de Klerk
Reason: Article is about White House getting ready to receive Mandela but worried that Mandela’s demand for not lifting sanctions on South Africa till his demands were met would be met with disappointment by de Klerk

Title: South Africans Discover A Patch of Common Ground
Reason: Article is about Groote Schuur minute negotiations held between the African National Congress and the South African government for talks on ending Apartheid but does not talk much about Mandela and F.W. de Klerk

Title: Mandela Ally Speaks of Broader Talks
Reason: The article is about an ally of Mandela called Mbeki representing the African National Congress and is about him demanding the formation of a constituent assembly with black majority. The article has statements from Frederick William de Klerk but is not related mainly to apartheid.

Title: African National Congress Wins Most Homeland Leaders' Support
Reason: Article is about African National Congress winning support of most of the black leaders of various groups in South Africa

Title: South Africans Open Black-White Talks
Reason: Article is about beginning of the Groote Schuur minute talks between African National Congress headed by Mandela and South African government headed by de Klerk for the abolishment of the apartheid system

Title: Excerpts From Mandela and de Klerk Remarks as Talks Open
Reason: Article contains the excerpts of speech by Mandela and de Klerk before the opening of the talks for bringing political change in South Africa and has Mandela highlighting that for peace among black and whites abolition of apartheid system is necessary

Title: Hard Times for Pretoria's Police
Reason: Article is about white people in Pretoria police resigning because of discontentment due to de Klerk’s policies and has Mandela mentioning that the black people will not tolerate violence by the hands of the police

Title: Rightists Urge Whites to Oppose de Klerk
Reason: Article is about a rightist white leader gathering white people to protest against de Klerk’s support to end Apartheid and mentions Mandela opposing the white leader and the protest

Title: Winnie Mandela Named in Beatings
Reason: Article is about wife of Nelson Mandela being named in a case involving the murder of a youth at her home in Soweto

Title: SOUTH AFRICANS GET ACCORD ON EFFORTS TO END VIOLENCE AND FREE POLITICAL CAPTIVES
Reason: Article is about Mandela and F.W. de Klerk agreeing for the release of other political prisoners and has Mandela highlighting that apartheid is still not over with the blacks still having no right to vote

Title: Mandela to Come to U.S. in June, Meeting Bush and Visiting 5 Cities
Reason: Article is about Mandela’s visit to the US and just contains a mention of de Klerk and Apartheid system

Title: White Farmers, in Despair, Desert de Klerk
Reason: Article is about white farmers opposing against de Klerk for his support of ending the apartheid system and mentions Mandela fighting for majority rule and against apartheid

Title: Outcry Over Visits From South Africa
Reason: Article is about protests over the visit of de Klerk to the White House being organized before Mandela visit to the White House

Title: De Klerk Begins Major Tour of West Europe
Reason: Article is about de Klerk beginning his tour of Western Europe for bringing change in South Africa from apartheid and mentions Mandela due to embark on a tour of Arica in a few days as well

Title: In Changing South Africa, 5 Deaths Reveal Unrest
Reason: Article is about killing of two white and three black people causing fear in South Africa among the black and white people

Title: INSIDE
Reason: Article is just a list of articles inside the newspaper

Title: PRETORIA'S LEADER PUTS OFF U.S. TRIP
Reason: The article is about de Klerk postponing his trip to the White House to let Mandela visit the White House first after outcry that Mandela being called later to the White House was an insult to the White leader

Title: News Summary
Reason: Article is just a list of articles

Title: Mandela Says South Africa Persecuted His Wife
Reason: Article is about Mandela defending her wife saying she is being falsely targeted by the South African government for the kidnapping and murder of a black teenager

Title: Paris Receives Pretoria Leader at Start of Tour
Reason: Article is about de Klerk being received by the French President in France on his Western Europe tour and mentions Mandela having arrived in Angold on his African tour

Title: African National Congress Suspends Its Guerrilla War
Reason: Article is about African National Congress ending all guerrilla activity to win the war against apartheid after negotiations between Mandela and de Klerk

Title: At Blacks' Funeral in South Africa, a Call to Arms and for More Resistance
Reason: Article is about anti-apartheid movements burying people killed in violence due to apartheid struggle
